data.title: Optima family fonts
data.text:
Post by Michael Zedler

Post by Vicent Giner

I'm using LaTeX and I would apreciate if any of you could send me a

copy of a family font called Function (or Futura) and another one

called Opus (or Optima). I mean, what I need is the PS version of them

(the .afm and .pfb files, or something similar, I think).

Optima is called classico in

ftp://mirror.cs.wisc.edu/pub/mirrors/ghost/AFPL/GhostPCL/urwfonts-1.41.tar.gz

It's ttf, but that shouldn't be an obstacle.

ftp://mirror.cs.wisc.edu/pub/mirrors/ghost/AFPL/GhostPCL/urwfonts_t1-1.40.tar.gz

Ralf Stubner

Post by Michael Zedler

I'm not sure if it's included in CorelDraw -- if it is, just get an

old version on ebay, they are cheap as dirt.

Yes, Bitstreams version of Futura is included in (some versions of)

CorelDraw, even under this name. See

TEXMF/fonts/map/fontname/bitsrea.map. However, since the OP asked for

'Function' and 'Opus', he might be looking for the Softmaker versions

which includ OsF (and SC?, can't remember). These are particularly rare

among sans serif faces. The only free (as in beer) sans serif font with

OsF that comes to my mind is the Linotype Frutiger that comes with the

MS Reader. The recently submitted fontools (somewhere on CTAN) come with

an installation script for these fonts. But then, these fonts have

absolutly no kerning. Question is whether that is better or worse than

the often realy wrong kerning data in Softmaker fonts ...

cheerio

ralf
